Constant and variable radius fillets. A constant-radius fillet has the same radius along its entire length. A variable-radius fillet has a radius that varies along its length. You set a different radius for the start point and endpoint. You can also add intermediate points, each of which can have a different radius. 1 Edge fillets Based on selected edges. 2  The fillets can be of constant or variable-radius, of different sizes, and of different continuity (tangent (G1) or smooth G2), all of which can be created in a single operation. 3  All fillets and rounds created in a single operation become a single feature.
